title: Windows 10 update
body: So a couple days ago windows 10 had an update. Now when I'm in a game the sound goes from low to high randomly and just now my game froze and my laptop has never done that until the update. Is there a way too fix this?

replies.body:
I've never heard of the random sound issue. Can you confirm there are no background programs causing this by [completing a clean boot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq3)?

As for your game freeze issue, this is likely resolved by [disabling the Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) that was recently changed in that windows update. Let me know if that resolved the issue for you.

The sound and the freeze issue has only happened since the update so I'm considering uninstalling the updates too see if it works. Is this a good solution? And will doing a clean boot get rid of important things I might need?

The clean boot can be done temporarily just as a quick check and will just prevent most programs from starting up with the PC. 

I definitely recommend trying both of those steps and letting me know what happens.
Sorry for not replying back. Turns out it got fixed after another small update
